I love Serial so much.

So do you guys think

I just feel like he's not even capable

Rudolph huh? Man I love that guy.
- Hey! Are you here for Allison?
- Oh no I'm just here getting some food.

- Oh, I heard they have
really good burgers here.
- Oh hey, I'm just getting some food.
Do you want to have lunch?

title: What It’s Like To Be An Outsider

comments.text: Yes ;(﻿
comments.author: Queen Naia

comments.text:
Every single body including our president Obama can relate to this video. 
Just hold on and break y out ur she'll and reinvent yourself. I don't know 
how many times Beyonce and madonna have done it. It's nothing new. You 
don't want to be alone. Don't be ﻿
comments.author: Be1smaht

comments.text:
This is my life in one single video... without the nice ending. It is tough 
being an outsider, believe me. I just want to feel like I BELONG. I hope 
that when my teenage years are over (and they almost are) it won't be a 
problem anymore, and I'll get over it and move on.﻿
comments.author: Princess Pancake

comments.text:
I talked to my teacher about this once. I told her that I can talk to most 
people, but I don't feel like I belong in any group of friends in my class. 
You know how there are different "clicks" in each class? You have the 
jocks, the bimbos, the nerds and then the outsiders. All of the outisders 
hang together becuase they don't belong anywhere else. Well, I was the 
outsider of the outsiders. I didn't even fit in with others who don't fit 
in. I have no best friend and no one truly knows me. And my teacher told me 
she had noticed, but she saw it as a good thing. I was the social triumph 
card. And I didn't understand, I was so quiet and I don't belong anywhere. 
She told me that was a good thing, because I can adapt and I include 
everyone because I know what it's like to feel left out. And now I love 
being an outsider :)﻿

comments.author: Jennika Salonen

comments.text:
This is everyday of my stupid unimportant life. Everyone looks and stares 
like you are some freak who has no life. Every day is a pointless battle 
against having thoughts of suicide. At the end of the day, you win. Only to 
wake up to the same repeated battle. Its endless. I used to love waking up 
to sunlight. Now I hate it. Sometimes I wonder if I could find a girl and 
raise a family... Then I hear a voice saying "HOW IN HELL COULD YOU FIND A 
GIRL?!?!? EVERYONE HATES YOU! YOU DON'T DESERVE A GIRLFRIEND! YOU NEVER 
DID! YOU DON'T DESERVE FRIENDS WHO CARE ABOUT YOU! YOU ARE A MISTAKE AND 
YOU DON'T HERE! YOU ARE GOING TO BURN IN HELL JUST FOR BEING ALIVE!" 
Somehow, here I am. I'm still alive. I've gone through this horrible shit 
all alone. Because no one gives a shit about me. Why the hell am I even 
writing this guys. I'm just done with this crap. I can't take this much 
longer. I have been nice to every single bastard I've met. And all I get in 
return is pure hate and cold stares. I don't get friends, I don't get love, 
I don't get happiness, and I don't get to die. All I Asked For Was At Least 
One Person Who Gave A Shit. Just One Person To Hug Me While I Cry. Just 
ONE. But, I guess not. I guess its ok to know I am not the only one on this 
blue sphere who feels like everyone hates them. I guess being isolated can 
really make a person think about how gosh darn lucky some people are. *I 
don't usually swear. I guess I just had to get something out of me. I 
apologize if I offended you."

If anyone managed to get this far, you have my eternal gratitude and 
respect.
If I knew someone cared enough about this comment to get to the bottom I 
would cry because some one gave a shit. Thank you....﻿
comments.author: GraphiteGames

comments.text:
It's sad that people don't understand or don't want to understand your 
feelings.. But that these people make you feel bad about yourself and your 
life.. It's disgusting .. But you can decide for yourself if you want to be 
controlled by them or not.. I know it's hard but don't give up, okay?!
I also was surprised to see that soo many feel the same way..but It's kinda 
nice to know that you are not alone.. I hope you feel better soon!
comments.author: Diana Rose

comments.text:
I felt so sad during the video, but then I got so squeal-happy(When you're 
so happy you squeal o-o) when Sara found a friend cx﻿
comments.author: Immortal_Dragon0

comments.text:
Thank you so much for this.

So many people don't get it. They don't understand why you don't want to 
socialize, because they don't understand that when you do you've gotten 
burned before. They don't understand that it takes a while for us to warm 
up sometimes because we are so used to being shut down. They don't 
understand that even after you're not really an outsider anymore that this 
mentality lingers and that it can be triggered by stupid stuff like a late 
invite or not being invited even if people know you can't make the event.

Things are different now, and it's a lot better than it used to be, but 
sometimes I withdraw again, and I have to have my friends pull me back up. 
It doesn't happen often now, it's not a constant state like it was in 
middle school, but it's just so ingrained from those years that it's hard 
to really see that anything has changed.

Thank you so much for this video. People need to understand this. More 
importantly, people need to know that they aren't alone.﻿

comments.author: Valianna Aribella

comments.text:
This my every day life.  Ever since I was a kid my life was this way.  In 
gym, I was always the last picked/odd man out when picking teams.  I have 
friends but not as many as normal people.  Even among my friends I am an 
outsider.  Frequently I will try to interject or take part in a 
conversation and as soon as I start to say something someone else cuts me 
off like I wasn't there.  Like this young lady, I spent a lot of my time 
working on doodles and drawing.  Although an outsider, I am the first 
person to give someone a ride or sacrifice my time to help someone, even if 
I have to go out of my way.  Living alone, I don't get visitors or anyone 
calling just to talk.  I feel like I'm in a retirement home as one of the 
elderly forgotten.  I don't even go anywhere by myself anymore unless it's 
to go shopping because things like movies, eating out, etc only reinforces 
the feeling of being an outsider when I look around and see couples or 
groups of people doing the same thing.﻿
